allegation of misleading or deceptive conduct
motion to strike out statement of claim
no material facts pleaded
trade practices act 1974 (cth.), s. 52

federal court of australia rules, o. 20, r. 2; o. 4, rr. 1, 2; o. 11, r. 16; o. 12; o. 19. the applicant's statement of claim alleged misleading and deceptive conduct by the respondents in breach of s. 52 (1) of the trade practices act 1974 (cth.). the respondents applied to have the statement of claim struck out, mainly on the basis that it did not disclose a reasonable cause of action. it was argued that the statement of claim did not plead any material facts which could form the basis of a claim under s. 52.
practice and procedure
application for leave to serve originating process outside australia
requirement of a prima facie case
exercise of discretion

citances.sentence: (Revised from Transcript) An application previously made by the Applicant for orders pursuant to O 8 r 3(2) of the Federal Court Rules to serve its originating process filed in the present proceeding on the Second, Third and Fourth Respondents overseas was rejected: Gough & Gilmour Holdings Pty Ltd v Caterpillar of Australia Pty Ltd [2009] FCA 1429. As previously noted, the requirement imposed by O 8 r 3(2)(c) that the person seeking leave satisfy the Court as to a " prima facie case " is a requirement to be assessed " in proportion to the nature of such an interlocutory issue ": [2009] FCA 1429 at [13] , citing WSGAL Pty Ltd v Trade Practices Commission [1992] FCA 510 ; (1992) 39 FCR 472 at 476.
